trans-unit.source: Add Authentication to Existing Azure Mobile Services App (iOS) | .NET Backend | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Add Authentication to Existing Azure Mobile Services App (iOS) | .NET Backend | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Mobile Services to authenticate users of your iOS app through a variety of identity providers, including Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Mobile Services to authenticate users of your iOS app through a variety of identity providers, including Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Add Authentication to Existing Azure Mobile Services app
trans-unit.target: Add Authentication to Existing Azure Mobile Services app

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the Quick Start project using a supported identity provider.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the Quick Start project using a supported identity provider.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the [Mobile Services Quick Start tutorial], which you must complete first.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the [Mobile Services Quick Start tutorial], which you must complete first.

trans-unit.source: Register app for authentication and configure Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Register app for authentication and configure Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: Press the **Run** button to start the app.
trans-unit.target: Press the **Run** button to start the app.

trans-unit.source: Verify that an exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.
trans-unit.target: Verify that an exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.

trans-unit.source: This happens because the app attempts to access Mobile Services as an unauthenticated user, but the _TodoItem_ table now requires authentication.
trans-unit.target: This happens because the app attempts to access Mobile Services as an unauthenticated user, but the _TodoItem_ table now requires authentication.

trans-unit.source: In the next tutorial, [Service-side authorization of Mobile Services users], you will user the user ID value to filter returned data.
trans-unit.target: In the next tutorial, [Service-side authorization of Mobile Services users], you will user the user ID value to filter returned data.

trans-unit.source: [Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services]: #register [Restrict table permissions to authenticated users]: #permissions [Add authentication to the app]: #add-authentication [Next Steps]:#next-steps [Storing authentication tokens in your app]:#store-authentication
trans-unit.target: [Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services]: #register [Restrict table permissions to authenticated users]: #permissions [Add authentication to the app]: #add-authentication [Next Steps]:#next-steps [Storing authentication tokens in your app]:#store-authentication
